docs.snippet: Pitcher Masahiro Tanaka told his Japanese league team that he wants to play in Major League Baseball next season, but the team, Rakuten, does not want him to go....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pitcher Masahiro Tanaka told his Japanese league team that he wants to play in Major League Baseball next season, but the team, Rakuten, does not want him to go.
docs.abstract: Japanese pitching ace Masahiro Tanaka expresses wish to join Major League Baseball in 2014, but it remains unclear whether the Rakuten Golden Eagles will release him before he becomes free agent in 2015; decision could provide window into how Japanese teams will proceed following $20 million cap on compensation to teams whose players leave for the United States prematurely.

headline.main: Japan Star in Demand but Also in Limbo
headline.print_headline: Japan Star in Demand But Also in Limbo

docs.snippet: The Yankees added depth to their infield and bullpen on Tuesday, agreeing to contracts with second baseman Brian Roberts, 36, and the left-hander Matt Thornton, 37....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees added depth to their infield and bullpen on Tuesday, agreeing to contracts with second baseman Brian Roberts, 36, and the left-hander Matt Thornton, 37.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees sign second baseman Brian Roberts to $2 million, one-year contract and pitcher Matt Thornton to $7 million, two-year contract.

docs.snippet: Daniel Murphy was Santa Claus and Zack Wheeler was an elf during the Mets’ annual holiday party on Tuesday. For some Mets, those roles have spelled bad luck in recent years....
docs.lead_paragraph: Daniel Murphy was Santa Claus and Zack Wheeler was an elf during the Mets’ annual holiday party on Tuesday. For some Mets, those roles have spelled bad luck in recent years.
docs.abstract: New York Mets second baseman Daniel Murphy, who has been the subject of trade rumors, dresses up as Santa Claus for team's holiday party; costume has come to be associated with bad luck for team members in recent years, with almost everyone who has played Santa at annual team party having a down season or ending up injured or traded.

headline.main: Murphy Adds Red Suit and Beard to Itinerant Mets Résumé
headline.print_headline: Murphy Adds Red Suit and Beard to Itinerant Mets Résumé

docs.snippet: The repercussions of the college realignments have been felt most by the so-called nonrevenue sports, forcing many teams into taxing travel schedules....
docs.lead_paragraph: The repercussions of the college realignments have been felt most by the so-called nonrevenue sports, forcing many teams into taxing travel schedules.
docs.abstract: Complex realignment in major collegiate athletic conferences has taken significant toll on the so-called nonrevenue sports like soccer, volleyball and baseball; new geographic realities of the conferences have forced many such teams into taxing travel schedules.

headline.main: Scrambled Conferences Keeping Teams Up in the Air
headline.print_headline: Scrambled Conferences Keeping Teams Up in the Air

docs.snippet: A change in the length of kickoffs to protect returners from concussions is working — and is cutting into their production....
docs.lead_paragraph: A change in the length of kickoffs to protect returners from concussions is working — and is cutting into their production.
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; more than half of all kickoffs could end up as touchbacks in current season for first time in NFL history, three years after league moved up the kickoff to reduce number of returns and concussions; other football news noted.

headline.print_headline: For Kick-Return Specialists, Opportunity Knocked Out of Reach

docs.snippet: Scientists have found that after a concussion, reactive oxygen molecules flood the brains of mice. The findings for the first time hint at the possibility of treating concussions through the rapid use of antioxidant drugs....
docs.abstract: Scientists have found that after a concussion, reactive oxygen molecules flood the brains of mice. The findings for the first time hint at the possibility of treating concussions through the rapid use of antioxidant drugs.

headline.main: What Happens in the Brain After a Concussion

docs.lead_paragraph: The architect David Rockwell has come up with an idea for pop-up playgrounds, with loose parts, that can be assembled quickly, at low cost.
docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on architect David Rockwell, designer of FAO Schwartz, W hotels and other spectacular buildings; says Rockwell has come up with an idea for pop-up playgrounds, with loose parts, that can be assembled quickly and cheaply in parks around New York City.

headline.main: In a Brooklyn Park Design, Movable Parts at Play

docs.snippet: Sectarian violence in the Central African Republic has forced 40,000 to huddle into a makeshift camp, mending from wounds and struggling with fears....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sectarian violence in the Central African Republic has forced 40,000 to huddle into a makeshift camp, mending from wounds and struggling with fears.
docs.abstract: Sectarian violence in Central African Republic has forced 40,000 to huddle into a makeshift camp Bangui airport; while arrival of outside military forces has brought some stability to capital city, most refugees remain afraid to return to their homes, saying militia fighters remain there.

headline.main: Uprooted in Central Africa, Too Terrified to Go Back
